page.title: 15WOODLAND NEAR TILMASTONE
page.content: {Longlands wood}lies opposite Doves Corner, east of the main A256 road. {Two generations old,}parts of this wood have been mature for some years. On a warm July evening, the{Corsican and{Scots pines}give an air of tran_ quility _ only the cooing of doves breaks the silence.{Larch, oak, beech, {hawthorn, yew}and{ash}are evident.{Ivy has killed some trees;{old mans beard and{honeysuckle}cling to others. Dead trees lie where they fell _ home for {fungi}and{insects. The{undergrowth}is mostly{ferns}and {bindweed.}In spring, areas are car_ peted with{primroses, violets, blue_ {bells, wood sorrel}and{anemones. In 1986{felling}is to commence. When {replanting,}7m wide avenues will be left. Here the public will be encour_ aged to{plant}wild flowers and plants in order to{attract wild life.
